Row.Text: Reveals all land explored by this civilization.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Note: Will not receive contact with unmet civilizations and city-states.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They don't yet have the Technology to sell this item (Military Science).
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You don't yet have the Technology to sell this item (Military Science).
If enabled, you can sign Research Agreements with other civilizations.
If enabled, you cannot sell technology to another civilization unless you have researched that technology yourself.
We have Technologies available to trade.
We have no Technologies available to trade.
The other leader has Technologies available to trade.
The other leader has no Technologies available to trade.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They don't yet have the Technology to sell this item (Scientific Theory).
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You don't yet have the Technology to sell this item (Scientific Theory).
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Science system is off in this scenario.
Request help from a player whom you've made a Declaration of Friendship with. This option does not carry a diplomatic penalty.
Demand tribute from this civilization. This option carries a diplomatic penalty.
Not allowed due to the absence of Vassals.
You are their vassal state, and they like it!
They are our voluntary vassal state.
They are content with your treatment of them as their master.
They disagree with some of your policies as their master.
They believe they are being mistreated as your vassal!
They are extremely unhappy with your rule over them!
They believe they are being enslaved by your rule over them!
You protected their cities while they were your vassal!
You failed to protect their cities while they were your vassal!
You refused to grant them independence when they asked!
You declared war on their vassal!
You declared war on them while they were your vassal!
They don't like some of our vassals.
They fear your acquisition of multiple vassals!
You liberated them without being asked to.
Voluntarily become the other civilization's vassal. A voluntary vassal may choose to leave their master at any time after {1_Num} turns have passed.
This civilization abandons mastery over all vassals. Only valid if the player has vassals, and is willing to abandon them.
This civilization surrenders to the other player and becomes their Vassal State. A civilization that capitulates cannot leave their master until {1_Num} turns have passed.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They already are a Vassal State of {1_PlayerName:textkey} and cannot capitulate.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They have no desire to become our vassal state.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]We must be at least in the Medieval Era to create vassals or liberate vassals.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They must be at least in the Medieval Era to create vassals or liberate vassals.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They cannot ask their master to revoke vassals!
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]We cannot ask our master to revoke their vassals!
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You already are a vassal of {1_PlayerName:textkey} and you cannot adopt vassals as a vassal.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They already are a vassal of {1_PlayerName:textkey} and they cannot adopt vassals as a vassal.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot become your vassal for {1_Num} turn(s) because it has been too soon since your vassalage ended.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They cannot become your vassal for {1_Num} turn(s) because it has been too soon since their vassalage ended.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot become their vassal because a special rule is preventing you from doing so.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They cannot become your vassal because a special rule is preventing you from doing so.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot capitulate because you have no cities or population!
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They cannot capitulate because they have no cities or population!
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot become their vassal because you are already a vassal of {1_CivName}!
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They cannot become your vassal because they are already a vassal of {1_CivName}!
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot become their vassal because you are already their vassal!
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They cannot become your vassal because they are already your vassal!
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This player cannot capitulate for {1_Num} turn(s) because it has been too soon since the last capitulation.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot capitulate because "Enable Human Vassalage" Game Option is not enabled.

Nullifies the Vassalage Agreement between you and {1_PlayerName:textkey}, granting them independence from your civilization. The leader will be grateful for this move, but you will no longer receive benefits from being this civilization's master.
Grant us independence or else! We are prepared to fight for it!

Nullifies the Vassalage Agreement between you and {1_PlayerName:textkey}, granting yourself independence from their civilization. As your Master, they reserve the right to refuse or accept your request. If they refuse your request, this means immediate war.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your chance of peaceful independence will increase depending on their opinion of you and their military strength compared to you.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot end your Vassalage with {1_PlayerName:textkey} at this time. Please consult the Civilopedia for more details.
It's time you learned some respect. (DECLARE WAR!)
Understood. We grant you your independence.
May not declare war on a vassal of another civilization (you must declare war on their master, {1_CivName}).
May not make peace as a vassal (peace is automatically made when your Master makes peace with this civilization).
Ask the leader to remove their troops from your border. If the leader rejects your request, they may choose to declare war on you, so be careful!
Because you have reached the {1_EraName}, you may now create vassals!
Facing near certain defeat, {1_TeamName} has surrendered as a vassal to our great civilization.
Recognizing your great strength, {1_TeamName} has agreed to accept your protection as your vassal.
You have surrendered your political independence in exchange for {1_TeamName}'s protection as their vassal.
You are now the vassal of {1_TeamName}!
{1_PlyrName} has acquired {2_PlyrName} as a new vassal.
After long deliberations, we have agreed to grant {1_TeamName}'s people their freedom.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]They are no longer our Vassal.[ENDCOLOR]

The treacherous dogs led by {1_TeamName} have taken up arms against our empire! They have declared their independence, and are willing to fight to the death to defend their claim.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]They are no longer our Vassal.[ENDCOLOR]
You are no longer the vassal of {1_TeamName}!
We have been granted liberation from {1_TeamName}! We are no longer bound to their political alignment and are free to pursue our own interests.
Viva la revolution! Our people have taken up arms to defend our country's right to independence from {1_TeamName}'s rule!
{1_PlyrName} is no longer the vassal of {2_PlyrName}!
{1_TeamName} has increased your taxes from {2_Num}% to {3_Num}%!
{1_TeamName} has decreased your taxes from {2_Num}% to {3_Num}%!
Because they have been our vassal for many years, we are now able to liberate {1_TeamName}!
Disables the Vassalage System. No vassals can be created.
Allows human players to become vassals of other civilizations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Note: If "Disable Vassalage" Option is enabled, this does nothing.
Number of Vassals in the World: {1_Num}
Vassalage does not begin until you enter the Medieval Era, or become somebody's vassal.

If a vassal can declare independence, they may revoke their status of being your vassal at any time . If you refuse this request, you will declare war on your vassal. They are more likely to ask if they feel they have a good chance at succeeding in their revolution.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your vassal may declare independence after the following conditions are satisfied:

If you can declare independence, you may revoke your status of being their vassal at any time. Be careful, as if they refuse your request, they will declare war on you. They are more likely to respect your declaration of independence if you have a strong military presence.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your may declare independence after the following conditions are satisfied:
[TAB][ICON_BULLET]Vassal's team has {1_CityPercent}% or less of Cities when vassalage started. (currently {2_Percent})
[TAB][ICON_BULLET]Vassal's team has {1_PopPercent}% or more of Population than when vassalage started. (currently {2_Percent})

[TAB][ICON_BULLET]Vassal's team has {1_CityPercent}% or more than Master's team number of Cities (team-wide) AND {2_PopPercent}% or more than Master's team [ICON_CITIZEN] Population. (currently {3_Percent} and {4_Percent})

Ratio between the number of total cities your vassal currently possesses (team-wide) and the number of cities (team-wide) it had when it became your Vassal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Team Number of Cities Now: {1_CurrentCities}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Team Number of Cities When Vassal Started: {2_StartCities}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This player currently has {3_PlayerCities} Cities.

Ratio between the total number of Cities your vassal currently possesses (team-wide) and the number of Cities your team has now.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Team Number of Vassal Cities Now: {1_CurrentCities}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Master Team Number of Cities: {2_MasterCities}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This player currently has {3_Cities} Cities.

Ratio between the total [ICON_CITIZEN] Population your vassal currently possesses (team-wide) and the number of [ICON_CITIZEN] Population your team has now.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Team Number of [ICON_CITIZEN] Population Now: {1_CurrentPop}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Master Team [ICON_CITIZEN] Population: {2_MasterPop}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This player currently has {3_PlayerPop} [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.

Ratio between the total [ICON_CITIZEN] Population your vassal currently possesses (team-wide) and the [ICON_CITIZEN] Population (team-wide) it had when it became your Vassal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Team [ICON_CITIZEN] Population Now: {1_CurrentPop}[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Team [ICON_CITIZEN] Population When Vassal Started: {2_StartPop}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This player currently has {3_PlayerPop} [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.

Liberate this vassal, freeing them from your control. This is a peaceful action, will not result in a war, and result in a very large diplomatic boost with your former vassal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]After performing this action, {1_TeamName} will no longer be your vassal. You cannot undo this action.[ENDCOLOR]
You may only perform this action after you have a vassal for at least {1_Num} turns. You may liberate this vassal in {2_Num} turn(s).
Your vassal's view of how you are treating them, based on the following fields:
There have been no incidents to modify your vassal's opinion of you.

You are receiving {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold Per Turn from this vassal, based on {2_TaxRate}% of their {3_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gross Gold Per Turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Taxes are divided evenly among members in your team.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Vassal tax rate is calculated at the start of the turn.
You may only apply changes to a vassal's tax rate after {1_NumTurns} turns have passed since your last adjustment.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You may make another adjustment in {2_NumTurnsLeft} turn(s).
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Taxes were never set for this vassal.[ENDCOLOR]
Taxes may be changed on Turn {1_Turn}.
Apply changes to the Vassal's tax rate. The changes will take effect on the next turn.

Are you sure you want to apply a tax rate of {1_TaxRate} to {2_TeamName}? You cannot change this value for {3_NumTurns} Turns. The tax will be applied on the following turn. [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This action CANNOT be undone.[ENDCOLOR]
Are you sure you want to liberate {1_TeamName}? This will liberate ALL civilizations in this team from your control. [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This action CANNOT be undone.[ENDCOLOR]

Are you sure you want to request independence from {1_TeamName}. If refused, your civilizations will enter [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]War[ENDCOLOR]. [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This action CANNOT be undone.[ENDCOLOR]

Voluntary vassals are vassals acquired through trade. It is a mutual agreement in which the vassal agrees to serve the Master in exchange for protection. Voluntary vassals can leave at any time after a brief period.

Capitulated vassals are vassals acquired as the result of being crippled in war. Capitulated vassals are completely subservient to the master and cannot leave their masters until they have satisfied a series of requirements.
There are {1_Num} vassals available to set taxes for.

Ratio between our [ICON_CITIZEN] Population and {1_MasterPlayer}'s [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ratio between player [ICON_CITIZEN] Population (Ratio between team [ICON_CITIZEN] Population)
Ratio between our team's [ICON_CITIZEN] Population now and our team's [ICON_CITIZEN] Population when we became the vassal of {1_TeamName}.
Number of Our Cities (Number of Our Team Cities)
Number of Their Cities (Number of Their Team Cities)
Ratio between our Number of Cities and {1_MasterPlayer}'s Number of Cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ratio between player Number of Cities (Ratio between team Number of Cities)
Ratio between our team's Number of Cities now and our team's Number of Cities when we became the vassal of {1_TeamName}.
[COLOR_GREY]Your master may change your taxes this turn.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Your master has never set taxes for you.[ENDCOLOR]

Request independence from your Master. After performing this action, your vassalage ends with {1_TeamName}.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your Master will have the choice of accepting or refusing your request for independence. If your request is rejected, you will go to war with the other player! The chance of peaceful independence increases the stronger your are in comparison to your Master.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]You cannot request independence until you have been a vassal for {1_MinimumTurns} turns. You can perform this action in {2_iNumTurns} turn(s).[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]You cannot request independence until you have met all of the required conditions for independence. Hover over the "Can Declare Independence" to view the necessary requirements for independence.[ENDCOLOR]
You are being taxed {1_Num}% of your [ICON_GOLD] Gross Gold Per Turn. You have no control over the Tax Rate {2_TeamName} sets for you. Taxes are set individually on each vassal team member.

They are receiving {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold Per Turn from you, based on {2_TaxRate}% of your {3_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gross Gold Per Turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your taxed income is calculated at the start of your turn.
As a vassal of choice, you are relying on {1_Name} to provide protection from your lands. You do not suffer restrictions that would prevent you from leaving vassalage as capitulated vassals do.

As a capitulated vassal of {1_Name}, you are heavily restricted in your ability to declare independence. Your suffer restrictions requiring you to grow your [ICON_CITIZEN] Population and cities to become competitive with your master, or your master must have failed to protect your cities from enemy capture.
Please move your troops from our borders.
Display raw numbers next to diplomatic modifiers. In addition, AI leaders will never hide negative modifiers when they are Friendly.
All Master-Vassal relationships are immediately and peacefully annulled.
+{1_VassalMaintenancePercent}% [ICON_GOLD] Gold cost for Vassal Unit/City Maintenance
